description: Linear Agent - Automatically attempt Linear tasks using Claude Code with isolated worktrees

userStories.title: Project initialization
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the project scaffolded with dependencies so I can start building.
acceptanceCriteria: Create package.json with: hono, @linear/sdk, dotenv as dependencies
Create package.json with: @types/bun, typescript as devDependencies
Add scripts: dev (bun run src/index.ts), build (bun build), typecheck (tsc --noEmit)
Create tsconfig.json with strict mode, ESNext target, Bun types
Create directory structure: src/, src/routes/, src/services/, logs/
userStories.notes: Complete: package.json, tsconfig.json, directory structure created

userStories.title: Type definitions
userStories.description: As a developer, I need TypeScript interfaces defined so all modules share consistent types.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/types.ts with Config interface matching PRD spec
Add LinearIssue interface: id, title, description, labels, comments, customFields
Add AgentTask interface: issueId, repo, worktreePath, status, startedAt
Add AgentResult interface: success, error, branchName, prUrl, summary
Add WebhookPayload interface for Linear webhook structure
userStories.notes: Complete: All interfaces defined in src/types.ts

userStories.title: Configuration module
userStories.description: As a developer, I need configuration loaded from multiple sources with validation.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/config.ts that loads from process.env
Throw clear error if LINEAR_API_KEY or LINEAR_WEBHOOK_SECRET missing
Create .env.example with all config keys documented
userStories.notes: Complete: src/config.ts with validation, .env.example created

userStories.title: Logger module
userStories.description: As a developer, I need structured logging for debugging and monitoring.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/logger.ts with log levels: error, warn, info, debug
Log format: ISO timestamp, level, message, optional context object
Log to stdout for server logs
Provide function to create per-issue file logger (logs/{issueId}.log)
Log level configurable via LOG_LEVEL env var (default: info)
Export logger instance and createIssueLogger function
userStories.notes: Complete: src/logger.ts with structured logging and file logger

userStories.title: Linear Client - issue fetching
userStories.description: As the agent runner, I need to fetch full issue details from Linear.
acceptanceCriteria: Initialize LinearClient from @linear/sdk with API key from config
Implement getIssue(issueId): fetches title, description, labels, state
Fetch issue comments if config.includeComments is true
Fetch custom field value for repository (config.repoCustomFieldName)
Fetch parent issue if this is a sub-issue
userStories.notes: Complete: Linear client with full issue fetching

userStories.title: Linear Client - updates
userStories.description: As the agent runner, I need to update issue status and add comments.
acceptanceCriteria: Status lookup: find workflow state by name, update issue
Add addComment(issueId, body) for markdown comments
Handle API errors gracefully, log and rethrow
userStories.notes: Complete: updateIssueStatus and addComment functions

userStories.title: Prompt Builder
userStories.description: As the agent runner, I need to construct prompts for Claude Code from issue context.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement buildPrompt(issue: LinearIssue, repo: string, branch: string): string
Include: issue title, description, repo path, branch name
Include parent issue context if sub-issue
Include requirements section with commit/focus guidelines
userStories.notes: Complete: buildPrompt and buildCompletionSummary functions

userStories.title: Task Queue
userStories.description: As the system, I need a queue to manage concurrent agent execution.
acceptanceCriteria: In-memory queue with add(task), getNext(), size() methods
Implement canStartNew(): returns true if running < maxConcurrentAgents
userStories.notes: Complete: Full queue implementation with concurrency control

userStories.title: Hono Server with health endpoint
userStories.description: As an operator, I need the HTTP server running with basic health check.
acceptanceCriteria: Update src/index.ts to import and start server
Log server start message with port
userStories.notes: Complete: Hono server with health endpoint

userStories.title: Status endpoint
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to see queue status and running agents.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/routes/health.ts with health and status routes
Each running agent shows: issueId, repo, startedAt
userStories.notes: Complete: Status endpoint in server.ts (combined with health)

userStories.title: Webhook signature validation
userStories.description: As the system, I need to validate Linear webhook signatures for security.
acceptanceCriteria: Use HMAC-SHA256 to compute expected signature
Return 401 with error if invalid signature
Log warning on invalid signature attempts
userStories.notes: Complete: HMAC-SHA256 signature validation

userStories.title: Webhook event filtering
userStories.description: As the system, I need to filter webhooks to only process label-added events.
acceptanceCriteria: Check if new label matches config.triggerLabel
userStories.notes: Complete: Event filtering with label detection

userStories.title: Webhook handler
userStories.description: As the system, I need the full webhook endpoint that validates, filters, and enqueues.
acceptanceCriteria: Validate signature first, return 401 if invalid
Parse body, check shouldProcess(), return 200 if filtered out
If should process: fetch issue via linear client
Extract repo from custom field, return 400 if missing
userStories.notes: Complete: Full webhook handler with validation and enqueuing

userStories.title: Git worktree operations
userStories.description: As the agent runner, I need to create isolated worktrees for each issue.
acceptanceCriteria: Handle 'already exists' error: return success if worktree usable
userStories.notes: Complete: Worktree create/remove with Bun.spawn

userStories.title: Claude Code execution
userStories.description: As the agent runner, I need to spawn Claude Code with the prompt in the worktree.
acceptanceCriteria: Add spawnClaude(worktreePath, prompt, logFile): Promise<{exitCode, stdout, stderr}>
Kill process on timeout, return error result
userStories.notes: Complete: Claude spawning with timeout in agent-runner.ts

userStories.title: Git commit and push
userStories.description: As the agent runner, I need to commit changes and push the branch.
acceptanceCriteria: Add hasChanges(worktreePath): Promise<boolean> using git status
Handle push errors (auth, network) with clear error message
userStories.notes: Complete: hasChanges, commitChanges, pushBranch in git.ts

userStories.title: PR creation
userStories.description: As the agent runner, I need to create a PR after pushing.
acceptanceCriteria: Add createPR(worktreePath, title, body, baseBranch): Promise<string | null>
Parse PR URL from gh output
Return null on failure (don't block on PR creation)
userStories.notes: Complete: createPR function using gh CLI

userStories.title: Agent Runner orchestration
userStories.description: As the system, I need the full agent runner that coordinates all steps.
acceptanceCriteria: Flow: resolve repo path, create worktree, update Linear 'In Progress'
Build prompt, spawn Claude, wait for completion
On success with changes: commit, push, create PR
Update Linear to 'Review', add completion comment with branch/PR links
On failure: add error comment to Linear
userStories.notes: Complete: Full agent orchestration with Linear updates

userStories.title: Queue processor
userStories.description: As the system, I need the queue to automatically process tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: Add processQueue() function that runs continuously
Get next task, mark as running, call runAgent()
On completion: mark complete/failed in queue
userStories.notes: Complete: processor.ts with continuous queue processing

userStories.title: Retry endpoint
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to manually retry failed issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Fetch fresh issue data from Linear
Return 409 if issue already queued or running
Add to queue, return 200 with { queued: true }
userStories.notes: Complete: Retry endpoint with conflict detection

userStories.title: State persistence
userStories.description: As an operator, I want agent state persisted for crash recovery.
acceptanceCriteria: Track running agents in state.json file
Implement saveState(runningAgents): void with atomic write (temp + rename)
On startup: load state, offer to resume incomplete tasks
userStories.notes: Complete: Atomic state persistence with recovery

userStories.title: Orphan worktree cleanup
userStories.description: As an operator, I want orphaned worktrees cleaned up.
acceptanceCriteria: Compare against running agents from state
Worktrees without matching running agent are orphans
If autoClean: remove orphans, log each removal
If not autoClean: log orphans for manual review
userStories.notes: Complete: Orphan cleanup with auto-clean option

userStories.title: README and cloudflared setup
userStories.description: As a developer, I need documentation for setup and tunnel configuration.
acceptanceCriteria: Document all environment variables with examples
Include Linear setup: custom field, webhook, labels, statuses
Include cloudflared installation: brew install cloudflared
Include tunnel command: cloudflared tunnel --url http://localhost:3847
Document webhook URL format for Linear
userStories.notes: Complete: Comprehensive README with setup instructions
